snippet: The Federal Trade Commission says pay-for-delay practices cost Americans billions annually in higher drug prices. The Supreme Court has given the government the power to ensure more market competition.
abstract: Editorial welcomes Supreme Court ruling that allows Federal Trade Commission to bring antitrust charges against drug companies that pay competitors to delay putting cheaper generic drugs on market; contends, however, that while ruling is step in right direction, it does not go far enough.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission says pay-for-delay practices cost Americans billions annually in higher drug prices. The Supreme Court has given the government the power to ensure more market competition.
